ownedComment.body: eli:LegalResource is a subset of dcat:Dataset. Our cccev:ReferenceFramework should be the base class for BREG DCAT LegalResource. cccev:ReferenceFramework is a subclass of dcat:DataSet and already includes the information of eli:LegalResource. cccev:ReferenceFramework is used for frameworks of both legal and non-legal nature.

properties.documentation: A condition for evaluation or assessment. Additional Information: In general, criteria are used for comparison, filtering and selection. Criteria usually set minimum constraints (e.g. limits, intervals, thresholds, etc.) that need to be met in order to pass the required conditions or to fulfil them in a certain degree or quality. The evaluation of the fulfilment is usually supported with the provision of evidences.

documentation.value: Relative importance assigned to a given criterion. Source: ePO
The explanation of how the weighting of a Criterion is to be used at evaluation time. Additional Information: Normally used for transparency matters. Source: ESPD and ePO

The numeric form used to weight. Additional Information: Typically these forms are decimal or percentage. However some business domains provide long lists of other types of weighing. See for example the codelist number-weight used in eForms1. Source: based on ESPD and EU Vocabularies. 1 eForms: https://ec.europa.eu/growth/single-market/public-procurement/digital/eforms_en.

Additional parameter used to adjust the evaluation of the criterion composed of multiple sub-criteria. Additional Information: In neural networks, the bias is equivalent to an intercept added in a linear equation used to shift the activation function to either right or left. It can be also used to manually adjust the pass/fail calculation of a weighted criterion.

properties.documentation: A source from where requirements are identified and drawn. Additional Information Usual reference frameworks are legal and non-legal specifications. Examples of reference frameworks can be, the ELI Legal Resources used for the BREG catalogue of datasets, the basis for the ISA2 CAMSS Scenarios such as the Regulation (EU) 1025/2012 or the EIF Framework, the European Directives used in e-Certis and the ESPD Implementing Regulation for the identification of exclusion grounds and selection criteria, a standard, a technical specification, etc.

A ondition demanded.c Additional Information: Generic class representing any type of prerequisite that may be desired, needed or imposed as an obligation. The European Directive on services in the internal market1 defines requirement as any obligation, prohibition, condition or limit provided for in exercise of their legal autonomy [..]. Source: based on the Collins English Dictionary, accessed through TheFreeDictionary.com hub.------------------------- 1 See Directive 2006/123/EU, Article 4(7), Requirements.: https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/PDF/?uri=CELEX:32006L0123&from=EN.

documentation.value: A unique value, in the context of use, assigned to the instance of this property or to one of its subproperties.
The preferred label used to identify the instance of this class or of one of its subclasses.
A short explanation about the nature, attributes, uses or any other additional information that helps clarify the understanding of the concept being instantiated.

The identifier representing the division within a system of classification to which the instance of this class belongs. Additional information The classification system is normally a controlled vocabulary (e.g. a codelist or a taxonomy) the use of which is commonly agreed by a community of users in the context of a business or problem domain. Source: based on sense #2 of the Merriam-Webster English dictionary.

properties.documentation: A datum. Additional information In the CCCEV the datum is always associated (or referred) to a concept defined in a specific namespace. The namespace is expected to de-referenceable and to provide the definition and type of the datum.

documentation.value: A monetary value, with the indication of the currency, provided as the response to a required concept.
A code identifier provided as the response to a required concept.
A date provided as the response to a required concept.
An identifier provided as the response to a required concept.
A Boolean value (true or false) provided as the response to a required concept.
A measure, and the unit of the measure, provided as the response to a required concept.
A decimal number provided as the response to a required concept.
A number of items provided as the response to a required concept.
A text provided as the response to a required concept.
The time (hh:mm:ss) provided as the response to a required concept.
A Uniform Resource Identifier provided as the response to a required concept.
A code used to identify a user-defined data type.
A text with the signature of a method (e.g. a Java function, or an endpoint call) provided as the response to a required concept.
A code identifying an exception when trying to provide an answer to a required concept.

properties.documentation: eli:LegalResource is a subset of dcat:Dataset. Our cccev:ReferenceFramework should be the base class for BREG DCAT LegalResource. cccev:ReferenceFramework is a subclass of dcat:DataSet and already includes the information of eli:LegalResource. cccev:ReferenceFramework is used for frameworks of both legal and non-legal nature.

documentation.value: The identifier of the currency as in the standard code list used. Based on the ISO 15000-5 CCTS.
The numeric value of the amount, including decimals.

properties.documentation: A character string to identify and distinguish uniquely, one instance of an object in an identification scheme from all other objects in the same scheme together with relevant supplementary information.

documentation.value: The literal identifying an entity, like a person or an object.
The identification of the agency that maintains the identification scheme.
The name of the agency that maintains the identification scheme.
The Uniform Resource Identifier that identifies where the identification scheme data is located.
The identification of the identification scheme.
The name of the identification scheme.
The Uniform Resource Identifier that identifies where the identification scheme is located.
The version of the identification scheme.

properties.documentation: A numeric value determined by measuring an object along with the specified unit of measure.

documentation.value: The numeric value of the measure, including decimals if needed.
The type of unit of measure.

properties.documentation: A counted number of non-monetary units possibly including fractions.

documentation.value: The numeric value of the quantity, including decimals.
The unit of the quantity.
The identification of the agency that maintains the quantity unit code list.
The identification of the agency that maintains the quantity unit code list.
The quantity unit code list.

properties.documentation: The intellectual work to evaluate an asset against the criteria of a given scenario. The evaluation process produces objective outputs that are then considered to form value judgments expressed as the assessment's statements.

documentation.value:
The current situation of the assessment.
Additional Information:
A list with different status codes is to be provided by context/domain-specific application profiles to identify the statuses that make sense for that context or domain.
Examples of statuses could be: In progress, Cancelled, Deprecated, Accepted, Superseded, etc

properties.documentation:
A resource, probably resulting from a work, with purpose and value.
Additional information:
This definition considers "resource" as a res available for use". (See the definition of res in the IFLA FRBR/LRM specifications).

documentation.value: A text explaining the value of the resource being assessed in the context of a particular scenario.

properties.documentation: The context for a criterion providing guidance on its evaluation considering the given scenario. This is used exceptionally to extend the context offered by the scenario when it is not sufficient for the evaluation of a given criterion. A criterion's evaluation produces an objective output that will then be considered to form value judgments expressed as the assessment's statements.

documentation.value: Guideline or description that needs to followed during the evaluation of one particular criterion.

properties.documentation: The context of the assessment establishing its purpose, the organisation of criteria being evaluated, and its reference frameworks.

documentation.value: The reason for which the assessment is done.

properties.documentation: The value output assigned to the criterion as part of the assessment.

documentation.value:
The literal representing the final score assigned to one criterion. Additional Information  
  • This literal is normally a number, generally a decimal.
  • Be aware that one criterion may have multiple scores assigned, especially when there is the need of identifying who is the agent providing the score.

properties.documentation: A value judgement, resulting from the assessment, pertinent to its entirety or to one or more of its specific parts.

documentation.value:
The categorisation of the statement.
Additional Information:
This code needs a context/domain-specific application profile codelist. An example of what this code can be used for is when there is need of signalling whether the statement is totally subjective, a judgement based on comparative actions performed upon several score inputs, a sentence picked-up from a database and as a result of an automated calculation, etc.
The favorability perception of the statement (e.g. positive, negative or neutral).
The text expressing the statements resulting value judgement.
The provision of a value judgement on one or more elements of the assessment.
The provision of context for the evaluation of the criterion.

The aggregation of criteria to one scenario or parts of it.
Additional Information: This aggregation may be contextualised at different granularity levels, scenario, parts of the scenario or specific criteria. The cardinality is 0..* to allow assessments that are very high-level, informal or subjective without criteria and scoring.
The assignment of a value output to the criterion.
A reference to the reference framework(s) a requirement is drawn from.
A reference to the reference framework(s) a requirement is drawn from.
A reference to the parent requirement a sub-requirement is part of.

A sub-requirement with more granular detail(s) or of different nature. Additional Information An example of granular sub-requirements can be a criterion defining more specific sub-criteria. Different examples can be found in different domains and situations. Thus, in the domain of e-Procurement EU exclusion criteria (a.k.a. grounds for exclusion), national criteria are implemented as sub-criteria hierarchically descending from an EU parent criterion. Neural networks can also be implemented as criteria and sub-criteria linked via the property cccev:hasRequirement pointing to a requirement of type cccev:Criterion. Examples of sub requirements of different nature can a criterion that defines different types of information requirements (e.g. evidences to support the responses to the criterion) and establishing constraints (e.g. input parameters, thresholds, or other types of restrictions).
An abbreviated manifestation of the performed assessment.

A manifestation of all the information related to and resulting from an assessment. Additional Information:
  • The included information usually contains everything about the assessment, e.g. the purpose of the assessment, the criteria defined in the scenario, the responses and the scoring provided by the evaluator;
  • The report may be manifested in one or multiple ways (distributed as different formats), e.g. as OWL triples, as an HTML, as a narrative text (pdf, doc, ods, etc.).
The reference to the asset(s) that are the object of the assessment.
The agent(s) that carry out the assessment.
The agent(s) that issue value judgement(s) resulting from the assessment.
The score provided by a given agent as part of the assessment.
The agent assigning the score for a given criterion as part of the assessment.
The agent(s) requesting the assessment of an asset.
The resource to which a domain concept relates to.

A link to any information supporting the value of the asset and any other related relevant details.
Additional information
A good choice to implement instances of resources supporting the value of the asset can be the use of the cccev:Evidence class from the Core Criterion and Core Evidence Vocabulary.

The different resources provided to feed the context for the evaluation of a criterion.
Additional Information:
For example, the assessment of the quality of a criterion that is answered by a multiple respondents, as the cases of an exam question answered by multiple students or the case of multiple evaluators evaluating the same quality aspect, etc.
The assignment of the scenario for the current assessment providing its context, purpose and criteria.
Triggers: The event causing further related assessment(s) due to the current one. TriggeredFrom: The event causing the current assessment as the result of another related assessment.

The creation of the statement(s) resulting from the assessment.
Additional Information: The cardinality allows for optional associations to express an Assessment that is typically a work in progress.
The evaluation of a criterion score in the context of the current assessment as input to issue one or more statements.

definedBy: The link to the scenario that provides the evaluation context for one or more criteria.
defines: The link to the evaluation contexts for specific criteria provided by the given scenario.
The consideration of a specific evaluation context when assigning the score to a criterion.
The definition of nested scenarios grouped based on different sub-purposes, commonalities or particularities of the sub-sets of criteria.
The provision of a value judgement on one or more elements of the assessment.
The provision of a value judgement on one or more elements of the assessment.
